title: â€˜Muito feliz e grataâ€™, diz Celina LeÃ£o sobre tÃ­tulo de cidadÃ£ brasiliense recebido pela CLDF - NotÃ­cias - R7 BrasÃ­lia
text: Celina foi elogiado por outros polÃ­ticos do DFRenato Alves/AgÃªncia BrasÃ­lia A vice-governadora Celina LeÃ£o recebeu na manhÃ£ desta quinta-feira (29) o tÃ­tulo de cidadÃ£ honorÃ¡ria de BrasÃ­lia. A homenagem foi dada pela CÃ¢mara Legislativa do Distrito Federal , proposta por dois deputados da Casa. Durante a sessÃ£o, Celina foi homenageada e agradeceu o apoio de polÃ­ticos e da comunidade do DF. â€œÃ‰ uma alegria muito grande. Ã‰ um momento que a gente faz uma reflexÃ£o sobre a nossa vida, sobre como a gente pode fazer mais pela populaÃ§Ã£o. Estou muito feliz, muito grata, de receber essa homenagem de uma casa que sempre tive tanto respeitoâ€, declarou. A cerimÃ´nia contou com a presenÃ§a da ex-primeira dama Michelle Bolsonaro e da senadora Damares Alves (Republicanos-DF). O tÃ­tulo foi uma iniciativa dos presidente da CLDF, Wellington Luiz (MDB), e do distrital Pepa (PP). Em discurso, o governador Ibaneis Rocha disse que tem Celina como uma irmÃ£. â€œFalar da Celina para mim Ã© uma questÃ£o sempre calorosa, a tenho como irmÃ£. Ela estÃ¡ comigo hÃ¡ muito tempo, desde que me lancei na polÃ­tica em 2018. E eu jÃ¡ conhecia o trabalho dela quando fui presidente da Ordem dos Advogados do Brasil e tenho certeza que Celina ainda tem muito a entregar para o DFâ€, disse. Ibaneis falou sobre a parceria com a vice-governadora durante o perÃ­odo fora do PalÃ¡cio do Buriti devido Ã s investigaÃ§Ãµes do 8 de Janeiro. â€œDurante meu afastamento, Celina deu toda prova de confianÃ§a e credibilidade, tratando a cidade com todo o amorâ€, disse. Wellington Luiz afirmou que quem ganha com a homenagem Ã© BrasÃ­lia. â€œPorque o povo com certeza sabe que ela vai continuar se esforÃ§ando, para poder corresponder todo esse carinho que todos nÃ³s temos por ela. Acho que Ã© um reconhecimento mesmo, a Celina jÃ¡ fez muito por BrasÃ­lia, tanto como polÃ­tica, tanto como cidadÃ£.â€ Durante discurso, Celina lembrou da infÃ¢ncia, do nascimento em GoiÃ¢nia, a criaÃ§Ã£o com sete irmÃ£os e o apoio sempre presente dos pais. A vice-governadora jÃ¡ esteve Ã  frente da Secretaria da Secretaria da Juventude, em 2006, foi eleita deputada distrital em 2010 e 2014. Em 2019, assumiu uma cadeira na CÃ¢mara Federal e se tornou vice-governadora em 2023. Outros polÃ­ticos e autoridades tambÃ©m jÃ¡ receberam a homenagem, dentre eles, o entÃ£o Ministro da JustiÃ§a, FlÃ¡vio Dino, o ministro do STF (Supremo Tribunal Federal) AndrÃ© MendonÃ§a e o ex-presidente da RepÃºblica Michel Temer (MDB).

author: Grace Opinker - The Times, Munster, Ind. (TNS)
title: Schererville personal trainer helps Libyan woman learn a chin-up
text:
Jan. 6â€”After nearly a decade of witnessing people brutally dying in war-torn Libya, Rehab Salem was desperate to find a source of happiness as her mental state continued to deteriorate.
"I lived through difficult days â€” anxiety, fear and escaping from missiles, bullets and the sound of planes," Salem said referring to the war that erupted in Libya in 2011. "I saw a warplane heading to our farm and our neighbors' farm, and bombing my neighbors farm â€” shrapnel falling like rain as we ran to escape from it."
Salem, a pharmacist, lives in the northwestern part of Libya, in a district called Jafara. Though Salem continued working during the war, she was forced to pause her career in 2019 when her workplace was destroyed.
Salem was psychologically drained. She turned to social media to communicate with the rest of the world. She began following chef Billy Parisi in 2020, recreating some of his Italian-based recipes. A few months later, Salem noticed Parisi mentioned Mark Zanders and MZJ Fitness on his Facebook page, and decided to follow him too.
Zanders, of Schererville, has been a personal trainer for 17 years. He officially established MZJ Fitness in 2019 working with residents in the Chicagoland area. (For more information visit
mzjfit.com ). Once the COVID pandemic hit, Zanders reverted to hosting online training sessions.
Salem contacted Zanders asking if she could train with him despite being thousands of miles away. In June 2020, Salem began sending Zanders videos of her exercise routine. He would send feedback and show her the correct form for certain exercises.
Eventually Salem began hopping online to virtually attend his Saturday morning boot camp classes. Zanders encouraged her to purchase dumbbells and TRX bands to get stronger.
"He taught me to be disciplined and keep going. Mark is a very patient man with me," Salem said. "I cannot describe my happiness when I participated in these exercises. I got better."
Nearly a year ago, Salem was determined to make Zanders proud by teaching herself how to do a chin-up. To practice, she placed an iron pipe between two trees outside of her home. Salem struggled at first, and even suffered a nose injury after the pipe fell on her face while attempting to pull herself up.
"I did not give up," she said.
When Salem successfully accomplished her chin-up, she immediately forwarded a video to Zanders. He was elated watching her achievement.
Salem accredits the improvement of her mental health to Zanders, although the two have never officially met in person.
"Mark is not only a coach in my opinion, but a person who feels for others," she said. "He feels for other people regardless of their religions, ethnicities and nationalities. He has a kind word for people."
Zanders originally went into this field to provide people with guidance and help them work through hurdles they've experienced. Being able to use physical fitness as a way to overcome mental health barriers comes easy to him, he said.
Salem has perfected various exercises Zanders has provided her with including squats, pushups, lunges and deadlifts. She's noticed a large improvement in her physical and mental health over the past three years thanks to Zanders.
"I have begun to love myself, invest in my health and stay away from everything that bothers me," Salem said. "I feel like I am still alive and breathing â€” I must live and adapt to every bad thing and make it easier to solve â€” and be patient."

www.nwitimes.com

Tribune Content Agency, LLC.

author: Alan Rose
title: Bright & mild New Year's Day on tap for Southern Colorado
text: Todayâ€™s Forecast: We're looking at a gorgeous start to 2024 across Southern Colorado! Today's nice weather will include mostly sunny skies, light winds and mild temperatures. Afternoon highs will top out in the 30s and 40s in the mountains and mountain valleys, with 40s and 50s for the Plains. Clouds will increase this evening as part of a weaker storm that will move south of Colorado on Tuesday. Colorado Springs forecast: High: 51; Low: 25. After yesterday's chilly high of 40 degrees, temperatures this afternoon will rebound nicely into the lower 50s in the Pikes Peak Region. Pueblo forecast: High: 52; Low: 23. A cold Monday morning will give way to a much more pleasant day as highs this afternoon will top out in the lower 50s. Canon City forecast: High: 55; Low: 30. If you're going to be out and about early this morning, you'll definitely want to grab a jacket and put on some warmer clothes. By the afternoon you can shed those layers as our afternoon highs will climb into the middle 50s. Woodland Park forecast: High: 44; Low: 19. A bright and sunny start to 2024 in Teller County will give way to a mostly cloudy and cold night, setting the stage for a cooler day on Tuesday. Tri-Lakes forecast: High: 40s/50s; Low: 20s. Although cold this morning, today's dry airmass will give way to some efficient warming, with our high this afternoon warming into the upper 40s and lower 50s. Plains forecast: High: 40s/50s; Low: 20s. A sunny and mild start to 2024 will give way to a cloudy and cooler day on Tuesday, with our forecast likely to stay dry over the next 24-48 hours. Walsenburg and Trinidad forecast: High: 40s/50s; Low: 20s. A mild and dry start to 2024, with mostly sunny skies during the day and increasing clouds this evening over the southern I-25 corridor. Mountains forecast: High: 30s/40s; Low: 10s/20s. A dry start to the week and the year for the mountains of southeastern Colorado. Clouds will increase tonight from a storm that passes well south of us on Tuesday. Extended outlook forecast: A weak storm moving to our south on Tuesday will bring us a cooler and cloudier day, with our high back down to the mid 40s in Colorado Springs. After a few degrees of warming on Wednesday, our late week forecast is now trending colder and snowier this morning. A storm system currently located more than 2,000 miles west of Colorado will move towards the southern Rockies late this week. Snow will be possible from Thursday afternoon into early Friday morning. Temperatures on Thursday and Friday will be below average, only warming into the 30s and 40s. ____ Curious about the First Alert 5 Weather Storm Impact Scale? [Check out our cheatsheet explainer.](https://www.koaa.com/weather/weather-science/first-alert5-storm-impact-scale-cheat-sheet) Watch KOAA News5 on your time, anytime with our free streaming app available for your Roku, FireTV, AppleTV and Android TV. Just search [KOAA News5](https://www.koaa.com/apps), download and start watching.

title: Presidente Joe Biden promete a Zelenski enviar â€œrÃ¡pidamenteâ€ ayuda militar a Ucrania
text:
Presidente Joe Biden promete a Zelenski enviar â€œrÃ¡pidamenteâ€ ayuda militar a Ucrania
Estados Unidos actuarÃ¡ con rapidez para proporcionar ayuda militar a Ucrania contra la invasiÃ³n rusa, dijo el presidente Joe Biden a su par VolodÃ­mir Zelenski en una llamada telefÃ³nica este lunes 22 de abril, informÃ³ la Casa Blanca.
La CÃ¡mara de Representantes dio luz verde la semana pasada a un enorme paquete de ayuda -largamente aplazado- que incluye 61.000 millones de dÃ³lares para Ucrania, devastada por la guerra, y se espera que ahora se apruebe en el Senado.
Biden destacÃ³ el â€œcompromiso duraderoâ€ de Estados Unidos con Ucrania en momentos en que â€œdefiende su libertad contra la agresiÃ³n rusaâ€.
PrometiÃ³ que â€œproporcionarÃ¡ rÃ¡pidamente nuevos e importantes paquetes de ayuda a la seguridad para satisfacer las urgentes necesidades de Ucrania en el campo de batalla y en defensa aÃ©reaâ€ tan pronto como el Senado estadounidense apruebe la medida, que cuenta con apoyo bipartidista, el martes.
â€œEl presidente Biden tambiÃ©n subrayÃ³ que la asistencia econÃ³mica de Estados Unidos ayudarÃ¡ a mantener la estabilidad financiera, reconstruir infraestructura crÃ­tica despuÃ©s de los ataques rusos y apoyar reformas a medida que Ucrania continÃºa su paso hacia la integraciÃ³n euroatlÃ¡nticaâ€, dice el comunicado.
En redes sociales, Zelenski dijo que agradeciÃ³ a Biden en una llamada el â€œinquebrantable apoyoâ€ a Kiev.
Biden â€œme asegurÃ³ que firmarÃ¡ de inmediato el texto, apenas sea aprobado por el Senadoâ€, aÃ±adiÃ³ el presidente ucraniano.
SegÃºn Zelenski, Biden le dijo que el armamento y demÃ¡s equipo militar que proveerÃ¡n a Ucrania en el prÃ³ximo paquete de ayuda militar â€œserÃ¡ poderoso, fortaleciendo nuestra defensa aÃ©rea, asÃ­ como las capacidades de artillerÃ­a de largo alcanceâ€.
El lÃ­der ucraniano tambiÃ©n dijo que hablaron sobre los Ãºltimos ataques de â€œterror aÃ©reo de Rusiaâ€, incluyendo bombardeos que afectaron a la mayor torre de televisiÃ³n en la ciudad de JÃ¡rkov.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Gonstead Chiropractic Center Offers Relief for Peripheral Neuropathy | User | times-online.com
text: Gonstead Chiropractic Center, under the guidance of Dr. Rich Benjamin, announces its commitment to aiding individuals grappling with peripheral neuropathy, a condition characterized by numbness or tingling in the extremities. The center now provides specialized chiropractic care targeting the root causes of peripheral neuropathy, offering hope for relief and improved quality of life. Peripheral neuropathy, a condition affecting nerves outside the brain and spinal cord, can lead to debilitating sensations of weakness, numbness, and pain, particularly in the hands and feet. Dr. Rich Benjamin explains, "Our body's wiring system, akin to peripheral nerves, facilitates essential functions such as movement and sensory perception. When damaged, it can disrupt the transmission of vital signals, leading to discomfort and reduced mobility." With a focus on patient-centered care, Gonstead Chiropractic Center employs a multi-faceted approach to alleviate symptoms and address the underlying causes of peripheral neuropathy. By combining cutting-edge medical treatments with personalized lifestyle adjustments, the center aims to provide rapid and lasting relief for its patients. Individuals experiencing symptoms of peripheral neuropathy are encouraged to schedule a 29 Point Sensory Exam, tailored to assess their unique condition comprehensively. Through personalized assessment and targeted treatment plans, the center endeavors to restore function and enhance the overall well-being of its patients. For more information about Gonstead Chiropractic Center and its specialized care for peripheral neuropathy, visit https://gonsteadchiropracticcenter.com/ now. About Gonstead Chiropractic Center Gonstead Chiropractic Center, led by Dr. Rich Benjamin, specializes in holistic care for individuals experiencing peripheral neuropathy symptoms like numbness and tingling in the hands or feet. With a patient-centered approach, the center offers personalized treatment plans, combining cutting-edge medical techniques with lifestyle adjustments to provide rapid and lasting relief. Media Contact Company Name: Gonstead Chiropractic Center Contact Person: Dr. Rich Benjamin Email: Send Email Phone: 8035479977 Country: United States Website: https://gonsteadchiropracticcenter.com/

author: Luisa Dias
title: Estudantes apresentam projetos de Engenharia de ProduÃ§Ã£o na Incubadora
text:
Os estudantes do curso de Engenharia de ProduÃ§Ã£o da PUC GoiÃ¡s vivenciaram uma experiÃªncia marcante com a apresentaÃ§Ã£o dos Projetos Integradores deste semestre, realizada na AgÃªncia Incubadora, localizada na Ãrea 3 da universidade, nesta quinta-feira, 5. Essa iniciativa, fruto de uma parceria entre o curso e os ambientes de inovaÃ§Ã£o da PUC, trouxe um novo significado ao processo de aprendizagem ao conectar teoria, prÃ¡tica e empreendedorismo.
O evento marcou a integraÃ§Ã£o entre a AgÃªncia Incubadora, o NÃºcleo de InovaÃ§Ã£o TecnolÃ³gica (NIT) e a AgÃªncia de InovaÃ§Ã£o, criando uma rede que visa ampliar a cultura de inovaÃ§Ã£o para todos os cursos e escolas da instituiÃ§Ã£o. LeÃ´nidas Albano da Silva JÃºnior, coordenador da Incubadora de Empresas, destacou a importÃ¢ncia desse vÃ­nculo. â€œA inovaÃ§Ã£o precisa estar em todos os cantos da universidade. Ao aproximarmos esses projetos da graduaÃ§Ã£o, estamos nÃ£o apenas motivando os estudantes, mas tambÃ©m potencializando ideias que podem se transformar em startups ou soluÃ§Ãµes aplicÃ¡veis ao mercado.â€
A professora Maria Ximena Vazquez, responsÃ¡vel pela disciplina de Projeto de Produto, enalteceu o carÃ¡ter multidisciplinar e colaborativo do evento. â€œReunimos estudantes de diferentes perÃ­odos para promover o aprendizado mÃºtuo e estimular competÃªncias fundamentais como inovaÃ§Ã£o e empreendedorismo. AlÃ©m disso, a aproximaÃ§Ã£o com a Incubadora oferece aos estudantes uma visÃ£o prÃ¡tica e uma chance real de participarem de editais e iniciarem seus prÃ³prios negÃ³ciosâ€, explicou.
Entre os projetos apresentados, o destaque foi para o EcoMush, desenvolvido pelo grupo liderado por Pedro Lucas Rodrigues Lobos, aluno do oitavo perÃ­odo. A iniciativa propÃµe embalagens sustentÃ¡veis feitas a partir do cogumelo, um material biodegradÃ¡vel e resistente a altas temperaturas. â€œNosso objetivo Ã© oferecer uma alternativa inovadora no mercado de embalagens, contribuindo para a sustentabilidadeâ€, contou Pedro Lucas, evidenciando a relevÃ¢ncia do projeto para o mercado e para a sociedade.
O professor Santiago Meirelles Rochas, que orienta os estudantes na disciplina de Engenharia de Projetos, ressaltou a importÃ¢ncia do ambiente da incubadora. â€œAqui, os acadÃªmicos conseguem transformar ideias inovadoras desenvolvidas em sala de aula em projetos factÃ­veis, conectando o conhecimento acadÃªmico ao mercadoâ€, afirmou.
Outros projetos apresentados tambÃ©m impressionaram pela criatividade e funcionalidade, como o sorvete com frutas cristalizadas, focado em uma alimentaÃ§Ã£o saudÃ¡vel, e cÃ¡psulas de limpeza que otimizam o cotidiano das famÃ­lias. A integraÃ§Ã£o dos Projetos Integradores com a AgÃªncia Incubadora inaugura uma nova fase na formaÃ§Ã£o dos futuros engenheiros de produÃ§Ã£o da PUC GoiÃ¡s, reforÃ§ando o compromisso da universidade com a inovaÃ§Ã£o e o desenvolvimento de soluÃ§Ãµes prÃ¡ticas e sustentÃ¡veis para os desafios contemporÃ¢neos.
Fotos: Wagmar Alves

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: What do zebra mussels threaten?
text:
The Zebra Mussel Threat: An Ecological and Economic Disaster Zebra mussels threaten a multifaceted web of interconnected systems. They pose a significant threat to native ecosystems by disrupting food webs, outcompeting indigenous species, and altering water quality. Economically, they threaten industries reliant on water intakes, such as power plants and municipal water systems , causing millions of dollars in damages annually. Furthermore, they threaten recreational activities and tourism , as their sharp shells litter beaches and foul watercraft. In short, zebra mussels threaten the delicate balance of aquatic environments and the economic stability of communities that depend on them.
Understanding the Scope of the Threat The zebra mussel, Dreissena polymorpha , is a small freshwater mussel native to Eastern Europe and Western Russia. It was introduced to the Great Lakes in the mid-1980s, likely through ballast water discharged from ships. Since then, it has spread rapidly throughout North America, causing widespread ecological and economic damage. Understanding the full scope of their threat requires examining their impact on various aspects of the environment and human society.
Ecological Impacts: A Disrupted Balance The most significant threat posed by zebra mussels is to the ecological health of invaded water bodies . This threat manifests in several ways:
Disruption of the Food Web: Zebra mussels are voracious filter feeders, capable of filtering up to a liter of water per day. This intense filtration removes vast quantities of phytoplankton and zooplankton , the base of the aquatic food web. This depletion reduces food availability for native species, including larval fish, invertebrates, and other organisms that rely on these microscopic organisms for sustenance. The result is a cascading effect that can alter the entire structure of the food web, leading to declines in native populations and shifts in species composition.
Competition with Native Species: Zebra mussels are highly effective competitors for resources, particularly food and space. They attach themselves to hard surfaces , including native mussels, rocks, and submerged vegetation. This attachment can incapacitate or kill native mussels , particularly those that are already threatened or endangered. By colonizing available space, they prevent native species from establishing themselves, further exacerbating their decline.
Alteration of Water Quality: While the filtration activities of zebra mussels can initially lead to clearer water, this clarity is deceptive. The removal of plankton reduces the turbidity of the water , allowing sunlight to penetrate deeper. This can stimulate the growth of aquatic plants and algae, potentially leading to excessive plant growth, algal blooms, and oxygen depletion . Moreover, the waste products of zebra mussels accumulate on the bottom of the water body, altering nutrient cycles and potentially contributing to the formation of â€œdead zones.â€
Economic Impacts: A Costly Invasion The economic threat posed by zebra mussels is substantial, affecting various sectors:
Infrastructure Damage: Zebra mussels are notorious for clogging water intake pipes used by power plants, municipal water systems, and industrial facilities. Their ability to form dense colonies on hard surfaces allows them to rapidly accumulate within these pipes, reducing water flow and causing costly shutdowns . Power plants, in particular, must spend millions of dollars each year to remove zebra mussels from their intake structures and treat water to prevent further infestation. Temporary shutdowns due to insufficient water flow can cost over $5,000 per hour, resulting in significant economic losses.
Recreational Impacts: Zebra mussels also impact recreational activities such as boating, fishing, and swimming. They attach themselves to boats, docks, buoys, and other structures, increasing maintenance costs and reducing their lifespan . The sharp shells of dead zebra mussels wash up on beaches, making them unpleasant and even dangerous for swimmers and beachgoers. These impacts can negatively affect tourism and local economies that rely on recreational activities.
Impacts on Fish Populations Zebra mussels donâ€™t directly attack fish, but their feeding habits have a drastic effect on the food chain , which, in turn, affects fish populations. They eat plankton , a primary food source for many fish, especially young ones. This competition for food can stunt growth and reduce the survival rates of fish populations. Furthermore, changes in the waterâ€™s ecosystem caused by the mussels can alter fish habitats, making it harder for them to thrive. The decrease in plankton can also reduce the availability of food for larger fish that rely on the fish that eat plankton, causing a ripple effect throughout the food web.
Counteracting the Threat: Management and Prevention Given the significant ecological and economic threats posed by zebra mussels, effective management and prevention strategies are essential. These strategies include:
Prevention of Spread: The most effective way to manage zebra mussels is to prevent their further spread. This involves educating the public about the risks of transporting zebra mussels and implementing measures to prevent their introduction into new water bodies. These measures include inspecting and cleaning boats and recreational equipment , draining water from bilges and live wells, and avoiding the transfer of water between different water bodies.
Control Measures: In water bodies that are already infested with zebra mussels, a variety of control measures can be used to reduce their populations. These measures include chemical treatments, physical removal, and biological control . Chemical treatments, such as potassium chloride, can be effective in killing zebra mussels, but they must be carefully applied to avoid harming other aquatic organisms. Physical removal involves manually removing zebra mussels from intake pipes and other structures, which can be labor-intensive and costly. Biological control involves introducing natural predators of zebra mussels, such as certain species of fish or bacteria, to help regulate their populations.
The Role of Education and Awareness A critical component of zebra mussel management is education and awareness . By informing the public about the risks posed by zebra mussels and the measures they can take to prevent their spread, we can significantly reduce the likelihood of new infestations. Educational campaigns should target boaters, anglers, and other recreational users of water bodies, emphasizing the importance of cleaning and inspecting their equipment. Collaboration with The Environmental Literacy Council is essential to promoting environmental education and responsible behavior.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) about Zebra Mussels 1. How did zebra mussels get to North America? Zebra mussels likely arrived in North America in the ballast water of ships traveling from Europe. When ships empty their ballast water, they can release non-native species, including zebra mussel larvae (veligers), into new environments.
2. What makes zebra mussels so invasive? Several factors contribute to their invasiveness:
High Reproductive Rate: They reproduce rapidly, with females capable of producing up to a million eggs per year. Lack of Natural Predators: In North America, they have few natural predators to control their populations. Ability to Attach to Surfaces: This allows them to colonize a wide range of habitats. Tolerance of Environmental Conditions: They can tolerate a wide range of temperatures and water conditions. 3. Can zebra mussels be completely eradicated? Complete eradication of zebra mussels is unlikely in most infested water bodies. Their rapid reproduction, dispersal mechanisms, and tolerance of various conditions make them difficult to eliminate once they are established.
4. What are some natural predators of zebra mussels? Some natural predators include certain species of fish (like freshwater drum and redear sunfish), diving ducks, and crayfish . However, these predators are often not effective enough to control zebra mussel populations on a large scale.
5. Are zebra mussels good for anything? While primarily considered a nuisance, zebra mussels can filter water, improving clarity . However, this benefit is often outweighed by the negative ecological consequences.
6. What is the best way to clean zebra mussels off a boat? Use a high-pressure washer to remove them physically. Dispose of the removed mussels properly, away from water sources. Also, consider using specialized cleaning solutions designed for removing aquatic invasive species.
7. How long can zebra mussels survive out of water? Adult zebra mussels can survive out of water for several days to a week , depending on humidity and temperature. Microscopic larvae can survive even longer in moist environments.
8. What is the impact of zebra mussels on drinking water? They can clog intake pipes at water treatment plants, reducing water flow and increasing treatment costs . They can also affect the taste and odor of drinking water.
9. What is the difference between zebra mussels and quagga mussels? Both are invasive freshwater mussels, but quagga mussels are more tolerant of cold water and can colonize deeper areas than zebra mussels. They also have a broader range of suitable habitats.
10. Can zebra mussels affect the price of electricity? Yes, they can. Power plants that use water for cooling must spend millions of dollars annually to remove zebra mussels from their intake structures. These costs can be passed on to consumers in the form of higher electricity prices.
11. What role does climate change play in the spread of zebra mussels? Changing water temperatures and altered hydrological cycles can expand the suitable habitats for zebra mussels, facilitating their spread into new areas.
12. How can I report a zebra mussel sighting? Contact your local or state natural resources agency . They will provide instructions on how to report the sighting and may ask you to collect a sample for identification.
13. How do zebra mussels affect native fish populations? They compete with fish for food by filtering out plankton, which is a primary food source for many fish species, especially young ones. They also alter habitats and disrupt the food web, impacting fish populations indirectly.
14. What regulations are in place to prevent the spread of zebra mussels? Many states and provinces have laws requiring boaters to inspect and clean their vessels before entering or leaving water bodies. These laws aim to prevent the accidental transport of zebra mussels.
15. Where can I find more information about zebra mussels and their impact? You can find more information on the websites of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), and The Environmental Literacy Council . These resources provide detailed information on the biology, ecology, and management of zebra mussels. Consider exploring enviroliteracy.org for additional resources.
Zebra mussels represent a complex and challenging threat that requires a concerted effort to manage and prevent their spread. By understanding their impacts and implementing effective strategies, we can protect our aquatic ecosystems and economies from the devastating effects of this invasive species.

title: The 11 Best U.S. Beaches That Stay Warm All Year Round
text: Do you ever crave a deliciously warm beach on a cold winter day? If you want to escape the cold and go to a place where the weather is a nice 65 degrees, then look no further than the beaches on this list. These U.S. beaches stay warm all year round. It means you can tan, have some fun in the fun, and do water activities any time of the year. Itâ€™s the perfect winter holiday for you to take. Letâ€™s explore the 11 best U.S. beaches that stay warm all year round. The oldest city in California is San Diego, which the Spanish founded several centuries before California became a state. Â©Unwind/Shutterstock.com San Diego is the ultimate destination if you like warm weather and amazing beaches. There are a myriad of beaches that you can enjoy for the entire family or just for you and your partner. From Coronado to La Jolla, there are many options. If you like a little more relaxed atmosphere, you can go to Coronado or La Jolla. If you want a little more action and to have fun, there is always Mission Beach, Ocean Beach, or Pacific Beach. The weather in San Diego is always absolutely amazing. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s known to be Americaâ€™s Finest City. The best part is, if you want to escape the beach you can always go for several hikes in many well-known spots throughout the county or go to the world-famous zoo . Gianni Versace was assassinated outside his home in Miami, FL. Â©fokke baarssen/Shutterstock.com Having fun under the sun is just one part of your vacation if you go to Miami. Its white sandy beaches are pristine and packed with people throughout the entire year. If you go walking down Ocean Drive, youâ€™ll see the numerous Art Deco buildings that are famous. There are many clubs and restaurants throughout Miami Beach. Itâ€™s one of the most photographed and filmed cities in the world. With Floridaâ€™s warm weather, Miami ends up being one of the most sought-after places to vacation during winter. If you want to escape the beach, you can always tour around many of the buildings in the Miami Art Deco District including fashion designer Gianni Versaceâ€™s mansion. Oahu is the site of Pearl Harbor, which is the military base bombed during World War II. Â©SCStock/Shutterstock.com The ultimate tropical vacation is located in Hawaii. You get warm weather all year round, amazing beaches for you to frolic in, and gorgeous views that will leave you stunned. Oahu is great for families and couples. Itâ€™s home to Waikiki Beach , the world-famous beach that has attracted people from all over the world. Head out into the ocean and you can surf till sunset. Afterward, you can head to a luau for a delicious feast and a show. is a television series that took place in Laguna Beach. Â©Juancat/Shutterstock.com Laguna Beach is famous for its pristine beaches that people from all over Southern California frequent. With sunshine and warm weather all year round, itâ€™s perfect for you to go on a little winter escapade. Temperatures never go below 60 degrees during winter. The best part is that if you want to do something more than just lay under the sun, there are many chic shops, delicious restaurants, and cool bars for everyoneâ€™s fancy. You can hike up the canyons that are close by for great views of the Pacific Ocean. Myrtle Beach has an average annual temperature of 62 degrees Fahrenheit. Â©Sean Pavone/ via Getty Images Just imagine 60 miles of beach and golf courses by the Atlantic Ocean. Thatâ€™s what youâ€™ll get in Myrtle Beach. You can lay out and tan under the sun, frolic in the water, and even go do water activities in the Atlantic. Everything is at your fingertips. If you want to do something different, you can walk on the boardwalk and play games. You can also go on the SkyWheel, which is one of the nationâ€™s tallest Ferris wheels. Key Largo, FL has an average yearly temperature of about 77 degrees Fahrenheit. Â©iStock.com/lucky-photographer If youâ€™re looking for a more adventure-style vacation, look no further than Key Largo, FL . It is considered the Dive Capital of the World, which means you can have fun snorkeling through the worldâ€™s largest artificial reef. You can also check out some old Spanish shipwrecks. Some of the fish you will be able to spot here are barracuda and parrotfish, among others. Besides laying under the sun and enjoying the beach, the Everglades is also nearby. Key Largo is located between Key West and Miami, which means you will also enjoy the ocean surrounding you. Kauai is known as the Garden Isle because it has a more tropical feel to the island than the others. Â©Shane Myers Photography/Shutterstock.com Although Kauai is less known than Oahu, it has a tropical rainforest that has attracted tourists from everywhere. The weather is amazing all year round, so you donâ€™t have to worry about being cold during your trip there. You can lounge around at the beach and not get annoyed by the multitude of people. Itâ€™s more secluded than other islands in Hawaii. If you want to do more nature-oriented activities, you can always go on hikes through the rainforest. LA is home to Hollywood, the entertainment capital of the world. Â©trekandshoot/iStock via Getty Images Los Angeles is a big county. And thereâ€™s so much to do. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s the entertainment capital of the world because itâ€™s home to so many celebrities. When it comes to beaches, you will enjoy every second of your time under the sun. There are also a myriad of beaches that you can go to. From enjoying the attractions and games in Santa Monica to frolicking with the stars in Malibu . LA has it all. If you get tired of the beach, you can always head east and dine at amazing restaurants in West Hollywood, tour around Beverly Hills and see if you can spot any stars, or even check out Hollywood. The temperatures in South Padre Island are great year-round with the average being 74 degrees Fahrenheit. Â©ruthannburke/iStock via Getty Images Located in southern Texas on a barrier island, South Padre Island is famous for its beaches and the nature center that is home to many migrating birds. While you are on this island, youâ€™re going to feel like you are in a tropical oasis. Itâ€™s 34 miles of fantastic beaches â€” white sand and beautiful, crystal-clear water. After youâ€™ve spent your day at the beach, you can always go bird watching to see the migrating birds . You can also spend some time with dolphins at the South Padre Dolphin Research and Sealife Nature Center. St. Simons Island is home to beautiful birds like gannets and spoonbills. Â©iStock.com/DorothyBlahnik Located off the coast of Georgia, St. Simons Island is a beautiful place filled with white sand and salt marshes. St. Simons Island also offers visitors a little history lesson because there is a lighthouse that was rebuilt in 1872. After all, it was destroyed during the Civil War. Besides enjoying the amazing weather and laying in the sun, you can always check out that historic lighthouse or fish off St. Simons Pier. You can also go bird watching or even whale watching. Orange Beach, AL has average temperatures between 59 degrees and 77 degrees Fahrenheit all year long. Â©Cavan Images/iStock via Getty Images Located on the Gulf of Mexico, Orange Beach is known for being a top location to do all sorts of water activities. You can lay out under the sun, but just make sure you have sunglasses on. Orange Beachâ€™s sand is 95% quartz so it will sparkle throughout the day and night. Besides some beach fun, you can also check out the buzzing restaurants and the Wharf shopping area. There is also a chance for you to learn a little history at the Orange Beach Indian and Sea Museum. The post The 11 Best U.S. Beaches That Stay Warm All Year Round appeared first on A-Z Animals .
